meanings.definition: A person who tailors or makes tailored clothing.
meanings.sent1: The talented tailleur created a beautiful dress for the fashion show.
meanings.sent2: I need to take my suit to the tailleur for alterations.
meanings.sent3: The tailleur accidentally sewed the sleeve on backward, making a funny mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her skills as a tailleur were like a magic wand, transforming fabric into elegant garments.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous tailleur ensured every stitch was perfect in the bespoke suit.

meanings.sent1: She wore a stunning tailleur to the gala event.
meanings.sent2: The tailleur he wore to the interview made a great impression.
meanings.sent3: The tailleur looked like it was straight out of a fancy magazine.
meanings.sent4: His tailleur was his armor, boosting his confidence for the important meeting.
meanings.sent5: The tailleur hugged her figure perfectly, enhancing her elegance.

meanings.definition: To tailor or make tailored clothing.
meanings.sent1: She learned to tailleur clothes from her grandmother.
meanings.sent2: I will tailleur this dress to fit perfectly for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: He decided to tailleur his own shirt, ending up with a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The designer's goal was to tailleur each piece with precision and care.
meanings.sent5: Watching her tailleur the fabric into a beautiful dress was like witnessing art in motion.
